title: Which is better, Minecraft or Roblox? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well that depends, both games have changed significantly. Minecraft I started playing minecraft on mobile around the update 0.3.0. That was in 2012ish. Back then the game was fairly simple and Redstone wasn't on mobile yet. Though I did learn about minecraft by an old friend who surprisingly also showed me Roblox. So yeah. Growing up I was watching minecraft videos all the time, be it from the Yogscast or TheBajanCanadian and even SkyDoesMinecraft (back when he did mod reviews). After a while my parents let me buy it on our craptop. I'll post a link later to a video of me playing it back then. But I played that all summer one year and my obsession was rampant. Keep in mind this was during my break from Roblox that I've mentioned in another answer. I didn't have many friends to play with back then, but I know play with some of my high school friends on our own server, and it's pretty fun. That's as brief as I'll get, I could write multiple pages on it. Roblox This game was my childhood, primarily due to the fact it was free. I grew up playing it much more, and learned quite a bit from it. Through Roblox I've made countless friends from the role-playing community (ww2 one). These include guys like Judeycakes and Colby, pretty much my only two remaining Roblox friends, and I play other games with them. My knowledge of history was expanded when I learned about the depth of ww2 beyond what I learned from my dad. Most of my memories were forgotten but lots reside in my old youtube channels. I'll link them. In the end it had a lot more replayabilitiy Conclusion I'll say Roblox was better. I say was because I refuse to play in the current state that it is in. I do still enjoy minecraft but I can't seem to play it without friends. Roblox was a game where I could always go back to with a different experience each time.
